title: Diasporic and Transnational Youth Identities in the U.K.: exploring conceptual themes and future research agendas
abstractText:
The aim of the seminar series is to stimulate discussion and critical thinking on Diaspora and transnational relationships in the construction and understanding of young people's ethnic and cultural identity. This overall aim is underpinned by four main objectives:

  1. To bring together a range of international, national, methodological and multidisciplinary views to explore issues of ethnic identities among migrant and minority ethnic youths in Britain.
  2. To contribute to developing and sharing research which critically reflects young people's identities, family relationships, social networks, and citizenship within minority ethnic communities, and look to inform international debates on these topics.
  3. To strengthen empirical and academic work by bringing together leading researchers in the UK, noted overseas researchers and non-academic users in order to promote knowledge transfer.
  4. To establish further dialogue with research users including policymakers, and practitioners working with young people and their families in migrant and minority groups in the areas of immigration, children and youth services, education, cultural diversity and race equality.

The seminars in the series are as follows:

  • Family, Diaspora and Migration 
  • Transnationalism and the Second Generation
  • New Technologies and Participatory Research Methods 
  • Promoting Youth Inclusion
  • Symposium
